Package tictactoe

Class VictoryChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • tictactoe.VictoryChecker
  • class VictoryChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to check if a player has won the game with the last move they made.
    Author:
    Tapio Malmberg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard
      The game board.
      private int numToWin
      The number of pieces in a row needed to win.
      private Coordinate playedMove
      The last moved the player made.
      private byte player
      The player (HUMAN or COMPUTER).

      boolean hasWon()
      Checks if the player associated with this VictoryChecker has won.
      private boolean isWinningRow​(Direction dir)

      • VictoryChecker

        public VictoryChecker​(ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard,
                      byte player,
                      Coordinate playedMove,
                      int numToWin)
        Creates a new VictoryChecker with the given attributes.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - the game board
        player - the player who made the move
        playedMove - the move made by the player
        numToWin - the number of pieces in a row needed to win

    • Method Detail

      • hasWon

        public boolean hasWon()
        Checks if the player associated with this VictoryChecker has won.
        Returns:
        true if the player has won with their last move

      • isWinningRow

        private boolean isWinningRow​(Direction dir)
        Checks if there are enough adjacent pieces in the given direction required for winning.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to check
        Returns:
        true if there are enough pieces in a row required for victory
